author: chfast
content:
I think there is a number of useful features "dynamic initialization" provides. Maybe someone from solidity can complete this:
- storage slots initialization,
- immutables initialization,
- creating sub-contracts,
- calling other contracts.

author: chfast
content: Maybe it is overkill when you only have static code to deploy.

author: chfast
content: But I like that the initcode is ephemeral. And we should add and promote other ephemeral code use because it does not increase the state size.

author: gcolvin
content:
Hmmm.  I hadn't thought of state size effect.  Downside is that we can't amortize the cost of deployment-time validation across multiple calls.  And without deployment-time validation we can't be rid of various runtime checks.  But I guess the VM still has to be able to run pre-EOF unvalidated code, so that might not be an issue.

For some of the others you mention, do you think we can find a way to handle them that doesn't require the ability to actually generate new code?
